results.title: In Shift, Israel Quietly Allows Jewish Prayer on Temple Mount
results.abstract: Jewish activists say they are exercising their right to free worship at a site holy to Jews and Muslims. But the change upsets a longstanding compromise aimed at staving off conflict.

results.title: Climate Change Contributed to Europe’s Deadly Floods, Scientists Find
results.abstract: Warming increased the likelihood of the record downpours last month in Germany and Belgium and also made them wetter, according to a study.

results.title: Afghan Refugees Find a Harsh and Unfriendly Border in Turkey
results.abstract: Even before the last week’s harrowing scenes at the Kabul airport, thousands of Afghans were fleeing over land through Iran to Turkey. But they are being pushed back.

results.title: Hissène Habré, Ex-President of Chad Jailed for War Crimes, Dies at 79
results.abstract: Mr. Habré, who received a life sentence for crimes against humanity including torture and sex offenses, was said to be out of prison for medical treatment at the time of his death.
results.byline: By Ruth Maclean and Mady Camara
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

results.title: T. Rex Was Fearsome but May Have Been a Picky Eater
results.abstract: The jaw of the Tyrannosaurus Rex had sensitive nerves that may have allowed it to differentiate between parts of its prey, a new study found.

results.title: A local government in Australia killed its impounded dogs over coronavirus fears.
results.abstract: The rural Bourke Shire Council said two of the dogs had become aggressive and the person who regularly found new homes for the animals became unavailable.

results.title: Taiwan begins using a homegrown vaccine after months of shortages in imports.
results.abstract: Critics say they worry that the vaccine, which has completed Phase 2 trials, is being used before its effectiveness and safety have been proved.

results.title: Forced to leave his home, former President Hamid Karzai remains in Kabul despite the risks.
results.abstract: He and the Taliban have long been enemies, but he has stayed in Afghanistan, hoping to work with the militants and help shape a new government.
results.byline: By Carlotta Gall, Austin Ramzy and Sharif Hassan
